alert.note: Alert for Coffey (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 5:26AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Anderson and northeastern Coffey Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 526 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Waverly, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waverly. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
